api

Interface Shape

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractShape, IShape, JShape, LShape, OShape, SampleShape, SZShape, TShape

    public interface Shape
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    Interface for shapes used by Tetris-like games. Each shape has a position and, implicitly, a set of Cells. The initial position and cell locations are assigned in a constructor, and thereafter the position can be modified by the shiftXXX() methods. The constructor also establishes a relative ordering of the cells. The getCells() method always returns the cells in this ordering, and the cycle() method always uses this ordering. No bounds checking is ever done in implementations of this interface; therefore, the position and the cell positions can have negative coordinates.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Shape clone()
      Returns a deep copy of this object having the correct runtime type.
      void cycle()
      Cycles the blocks within the cells of this shape.
      Cell[] getCells()
      Returns a new array of Cell objects representing the blocks in this shape along with their absolute positions.
      void shiftDown()
      Shifts the position of this shape down (increasing the row) by one.
      void shiftLeft()
      Shifts the position of this shape left (decreasing the column) by one.
      void shiftRight()
      Shifts the position of this shape right (increasing the column) by one.
      void transform()
      Transforms this shape without altering its position according to the rules of the game to be implemented.

    • Method Detail

      • getCells

        Cell[] getCells()
        Returns a new array of Cell objects representing the blocks in this shape along with their absolute positions. (Note that modifications to the array or Cell objects returned by this method should NOT affect this shape.)
        Returns:
        the cells occupied by this shape

      • shiftDown

        void shiftDown()
        Shifts the position of this shape down (increasing the row) by one. No bounds checking is done.

      • shiftLeft

        void shiftLeft()
        Shifts the position of this shape left (decreasing the column) by one. No bounds checking is done.

      • shiftRight

        void shiftRight()
        Shifts the position of this shape right (increasing the column) by one. No bounds checking is done.

      • transform

        void transform()
        Transforms this shape without altering its position according to the rules of the game to be implemented. Typical operations are rotation and reflection. No bounds checking is done.

      • cycle

        void cycle()
        Cycles the blocks within the cells of this shape. Each block is shifted forward to the next cell (in the original ordering of the cells). The last block wraps around to the first cell.

      • clone

        Shape clone()
        Returns a deep copy of this object having the correct runtime type.
        Returns:
        a deep copy of this object
